content: quote: LONDON - Pakistan has asked Washington for "ownership" of US drones carrying out attacks on its territory, President Asif Ali Zardari said May 13. "Democracy doesn't believe in half measures. We've asked for the ownership of the drones," he said, when asked about reports that the U.S. has agreed to pass control of drone aircraft to Islamabad. Now that's funny! +http://www.defensenews.com/story.php?i=4088237&c=ASI&s=TOP "None are more hopelessly enslaved than those who falsely believe they are free." -Johann Wolfgang von Goethe
quote: LONDON - Pakistan has asked Washington for "ownership" of US drones carrying out attacks on its territory, President Asif Ali Zardari said May 13. "Democracy doesn't believe in half measures. We've asked for the ownership of the drones," he said, when asked about reports that the U.S. has agreed to pass control of drone aircraft to Islamabad.

title: Pakistan Wants 'Ownership' of U.S. Drones

content: Can we let the Military take over already? Damn, its going to happen eventually, might as well let it happen now...

title: Pakistan Wants 'Ownership' of U.S. Drones

content: We've been supplying military equipment to Pakistan for decades. Presently, dozens of countries have drones including Iran. Remember U-2 pilot (1960) Francis Gary Powers flew from Pakistan the day he was shot down by the Soviets. You might be interested in who instructed the Pakistan pilots during the early 70's. "On June 22, 1969, he was promoted to brigadier general, and was assigned in July as the vice-commander of the Seventeenth Air Force. In 1971, Yeager was assigned to Pakistan to advise the Pakistan Air Force at the behest of then-Ambassador Joe Farland.[14] Prior to the start of hostilities of the Bangladesh War he is reported to have said that the Pakistani army would be in New Delhi within a week.[15] During the war, his twin-engined Beechcraft was destroyed in an Indian air raid on the Chaklala air base - he was reportedly incensed and demanded US retaliation.[16] Despite Pakistan's surrender to India in the Indo-Pakistani War of 1971, Yeager stayed in Pakistan until March 1973, and recalled his stay in Pakistan as one of the most enjoyable times of his life. During his stay he spent most of his time flying in an F-86 Sabre with the Pakistan Air Force and making several expeditions to the K2 mountain, vactioning in Swat, Pakistan, trekking and hunting in the Northern Areas and learning the Urdu language". "http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chuck_Yeager Our Congress has stipulated in the bill that monies will be allowed after Doctor Khan is interrogated by American on his knowledge Iran nuclear development.
reply: We've been supplying military equipment to Pakistan for decades. Presently, dozens of countries have drones including Iran. Remember U-2 pilot (1960) Francis Gary Powers flew from Pakistan the day he was shot down by the Soviets. You might be interested in who instructed the Pakistan pilots during the early 70's. "On June 22, 1969, he was promoted to brigadier general, and was assigned in July as the vice-commander of the Seventeenth Air Force. In 1971, Yeager was assigned to Pakistan to advise the Pakistan Air Force at the behest of then-Ambassador Joe Farland.[14] Prior to the start of hostilities of the Bangladesh War he is reported to have said that the Pakistani army would be in New Delhi within a week.[15] During the war, his twin-engined Beechcraft was destroyed in an Indian air raid on the Chaklala air base - he was reportedly incensed and demanded US retaliation.[16] Despite Pakistan's surrender to India in the Indo-Pakistani War of 1971, Yeager stayed in Pakistan until March 1973, and recalled his stay in Pakistan as one of the most enjoyable times of his life. During his stay he spent most of his time flying in an F-86 Sabre with the Pakistan Air Force and making several expeditions to the K2 mountain, vactioning in Swat, Pakistan, trekking and hunting in the Northern Areas and learning the Urdu language". "http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chuck_Yeager Our Congress has stipulated in the bill that monies will be allowed after Doctor Khan is interrogated by American on his knowledge Iran nuclear development.
title: Pakistan Wants 'Ownership' of U.S. Drones
